controller

Class ToDoController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ToDoController

  • public class ToDoController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all the program logic. The purpose of this class is to handle all logic related to the ToDo list. It handles adding, deleting, updating and changing fields related to the ToDo lists and the ToDo items. The controller interacts with and changes the model's fields.
    Author:
    Zachary Winans, Laynah Varnum, Ziad Hakim, Jiazheng Huang

      This is the controller class's constructor that takes in the model.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(ToDoList list,
                ToDo item)
        This method adds a ToDo item to a list. The purpose of this method is to take in a list object and a ToDo object and add the ToDo object to the given list. It calls the model's addItem method to add the new ToDo object and update the view.
        Parameters:
        list - A ToDoList object
        item - A ToDo object

      • addList

        public void addList(ToDoList list)
        This method adds a whole new list. The purpose of this method is to take in a new ToDoList object and add it to the model's data structure. The method calls the model's newList method in order to add the list object and update the view.
        Parameters:
        list - A ToDoList object

      • delete

        public void delete(ToDoList list,
                   ToDo item)
        This method removes a ToDo item. The purpose of this method is to take in a list object and a ToDo item and delete the specified item from the specified list. It calls the model's removeItemAt method to delete the ToDo object from the list and no longer display it.
        Parameters:
        list - A ToDoList object
        item - A ToDo object

      • getTodoAtIndex

        public ToDo getTodoAtIndex(ToDoList list,
                           int i)
        This method returns a ToDo item at a given index. The purpose of this method is to take in a list object and an index and find the ToDo object at that index in the given list. It calls the model's getItemAt method in order to get the ToDo item from the given list and return it.
        Parameters:
        list - A ToDoList object
        i - An int representing an index
        Returns:
        A ToDo object

      • renameList

        public void renameList(ToDoList curr,
                       java.lang.String i)

      • getMap

        public java.util.TreeMap<ToDoList,java.util.ArrayList<ToDo>> getMap()
        This method returns the model's map. The purpose of this method is to return the data structure holding all ToDoLists and ToDo objects. It calls the model's getMap method in order to return the TreeMap that holds all the ToDo data.
        Returns:
        A TreeMap holding all ToDoLists and ToDo objects

      • sort

        public void sort(ToDoList list,
                 java.lang.String direction)
        This method sorts the ToDo objects. The purpose of this method is to take in a list object and a sort parameter in order to sort the ToDos in a list. It uses the direction parameter to determine how the ToDos in the given list should be sorted. It then arranges them that way for the view.
        Parameters:
        list - A ToDoList object
        direction - A String representing how the data should be sorted

      • getTodos

        public java.util.ArrayList<ToDo> getTodos(ToDoList list)
        This method returns a list of ToDos. The purpose of this method is to take in a list object and use it to return the list of ToDos in that object. It calls the model's getToDos method in order to find and return the specified list's collection of ToDo objects.
        Parameters:
        list - A ToDoList object
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of ToDo objects

      • getTodosAt

        public java.util.ArrayList<ToDo> getTodosAt(int index)
        This method gets the ToDos at a given index. The purpose of this method is to take in a list index and return the ToDos in that list. It calls the model's getListAtIndex method in order to get the list at the specified index. It then calls The model's getToDos method to get the ToDo objects in the found list.
        Parameters:
        index - An int representing a list index
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of ToDo objects

      • getLists

        public java.util.Set<ToDoList> getLists()
        This method returns ToDoList objects. The purpose of this method is to get all the ToDoList objects that the model is storing. It calls the model's getToDoLists method in order to return the set of all lists.
        Returns:
        A Set of ToDoList objects

      • getListAtIndex

        public ToDoList getListAtIndex(int i)
        This method gets a list at a given index. The purpose of this method is to take in an index value and return the ToDoList at that index. It calls the model's getListAtMethod in order to return the list at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        i - An int representing an index
        Returns:
        A ToDoList object

      • renameToDo

        public void renameToDo(ToDoList list,
                       int i,
                       java.lang.String name)
        This method renames a ToDo object. The purpose of this method is take in a list object, an index and a new title in order to change the name of a ToDo. It creates a new ToDo object with all the features of the previous one, changing only the title to match the new one. It then replaces the old ToDo object in the model.
        Parameters:
        list - A ToDoList object
        i - An int representing an index
        name - A String representing a new title

      • hide

        public void hide(ToDo item)
        This method hides a ToDo object. The purpose of this method is to take in a ToDo item and change its visibility to be hidden. Once setShown is set to false, the ToDo will no longer show up on the view.
        Parameters:
        item - A ToDo object

      • makeAllShown

        public void makeAllShown()
        This method shows all hidden ToDos. The purpose of this method is to make all hidden ToDo objects visible on the view again. Once done, all ToDos marked as hidden will show up in their respective lists.

      • setDone

        public void setDone(ToDo todo,
                    boolean i)
        This method sets an item to done or undone. The purpose of this method is to take in a ToDo item and a boolean and set the ToDo's done field to the boolean. If a ToDo object is marked as done, it will be marked undone. If it is not done, it will be marked as done. This is indicated with an 'X' before the title.
        Parameters:
        todo - A ToDo object
        i - A boolean representing how the object should be marked

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone(ToDo todo)
        This method checks if an item is marked as done. The purpose of this method is to take in a ToDo object and check if its done field is marked true or false. It will return the associated value.
        Parameters:
        todo - A ToDo object
        Returns:
        A boolean representing if the item is done or not

      • saveState

        public void saveState()
        This method calls the model to save the ToDo date in a file.

      • loadState

        public java.util.TreeMap<ToDoList,java.util.ArrayList<ToDo>> loadState()
        This method calls the model to load ToDo data from a file.
        Returns:
        A TreeMap of all saved lists and ToDos
